title: TABLE_PRIVILEGES view | Snowflake Documentation
paragraphs: This Information Schema view displays a row for each table privilege that has been granted to each role in the specified (or current) database.
For more information about roles and privileges, see Overview of Access Control.
APPLICABLE_ROLES view , ENABLED_ROLES view , OBJECT_PRIVILEGES view
Role who granted the table privilege
Role to whom the table privilege is granted
Type of object that has been granted the privilege
Database containing the table on which the privilege is granted
Schema containing the table on which the privilege is granted
Name of the table on which the privilege is granted
Whether the privilege was granted WITH GRANT OPTION
The view only displays objects for which the current role for the session has been granted access privileges.

The PRIVILEGE_TYPE column contains Snowflake privilege types. For example, the owner of a table has the OWNERSHIP privilege, rather than each of the separate privileges (e.g. SELECT, INSERT, DELETE,
UPDATE).
